results.title: It's your heart
results.brief_description: Men who have suffered heart attacks tell their stories while the film shows them at exercise or at work. There is also a lecture by a heart specialist to a group of men and women in which he answers questions ranging from diet to sexual activity.

results.title: It's Your Art
results.brief_description: This video introduces the art collection of the Australian National Gallery, Canberra, which houses over 86,000 works of Australian and international art. While exploring the diversity of the National Collection, the video also investigates the relationships between various works on display. The Gallery’s outstanding collection of Australian art and its important contemporary works provide the focus of the video, which presents an informative and stimulating guide to ways of viewing the collection and understanding the role of the gallery.

results.title: It's wonderful being a girl
results.brief_description: Explains the menstrual process, emphasising the normalcy of menstruation. Discusses good health habits, and gives tips on good grooming and poise.

results.title: It's up to you: fire protection
results.brief_description: Smokey Bear, a cartoon figure, makes a direct appeal to everyone to help in preventing forest fires. He explains how fires have caused in one year the loss of enough timber to supply the building needs of a large city. He shows a family picnic party carefully putting out their camp fire, while the father grinds his match and pipe ash into the ground.

results.title: It's up to you
results.brief_description: A survey of supervisory problems which arise in business organisations. The importance of conscientiously developing qualities of executive leadership is illustrated by the story of a junior executive in merchandising who realises that his effectiveness as a leader depends upon his acceptance and application of sound practices in human relations.

results.title: It's up to us
results.brief_description: The Intellectual Disability Rights service have produced this video to help disabled people to deal with rights and responsibilities at work. It includes issues such as safety, sexual harrassment, the right to be treated fairly, the right to choose your own friends and to have relationships. The second section looks at why people may want a workers committee and how one group of workers set one up.

results.title: It's time to go
results.creator_credit: Cheryl Seymour, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Seymour family had struggled for years to keep the farm viable, despite rising interest rates, falling prices, droughts and fires. As the family got older and circumstances changed, it was time to make an important decision.

results.title: It's the only body you've got
results.creator_credit: Paul Griffiths Presentations, National Heart Foundation of Australia and Roslyn Simms
results.brief_description: Deals with the relationship between diet and heart disease. Outlines the risk factors which contribute to coronary heart disease and advises on correct nutrition and diet to minimise these risks. Especially designed for secondary school students.
